> > I have 2 interfaces "DocumentPool" and "Document" and multiple
> > implementions of these (like HTMLPool, WordDocPool). The target is to
> > link these (about 50.000) docs using different "rules".
> > 
> > should i write my unit tests for each implementation or could i save
> > time by writing one testcase to test the interface?
> 
> If the interface represents a contract of sorts, you should probably write
> a
> common test case, and re-use it in the test cases for the concrete
> classes.

I'd like to add that even in that case you will most probably have two kinds
of tests: 
(1) Specification-based tests (the contract) which can be shared between
implementations 
(2) Implementation-based tests which are specific for every implementation

Johannes
